moxie

Class MoxieRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • moxie.MoxieRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.MethodRule

    public class MoxieRule
extends Object
implements org.junit.rules.MethodRule
    JUnit 4 MethodRule which automatically sets up mocks prior to each test method, and verifies them afterwards.

    Use MoxieRule by adding an annotated field to your test, as follows - this will cause MoxieRule to get picked up and used by the JUnit 4 test runner. 

     @org.junit.Rule
 public MoxieRule moxie = new MoxieRule();
    MoxieRule will use Moxie.autoMock() before each test method to populate annotated fields on your test instance with mock/spy objects. After the method completes, it will verify your mocks if the test was otherwise successful, then Moxie.autoUnmock() your test instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoxieRule()
      Creates a new MoxieRule using the thread-local instance of MoxieControl.
